meanings.definition: A type of crustacean with a segmented body and long antennae.
meanings.sent1: The schizopods scuttled along the ocean floor, their segmented bodies shining in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the schizopods to learn more about their unique body structure.
meanings.sent3: The schizopods decided to have a race to see who could reach the coral reef first.
meanings.sent4: In the world of the ocean, the schizopods were like tiny armored knights, protecting their underwater kingdom.
meanings.sent5: Children visiting the aquarium were fascinated by the schizopods, watching them move gracefully through the water.

meanings.definition: Plural form of schizopod, referring to multiple individuals of the same species.
meanings.sent1: A school of schizopods swam together, creating a mesmerizing sight in the clear water.
meanings.sent2: The beachcombers collected various shells, including those of the schizopods.
meanings.sent3: At the marine biology conference, the schizopods were the talk of the town.
meanings.sent4: The field guide highlighted the different species of schizopods found in the region.
meanings.sent5: The fishermen were amazed by the abundance of schizopods in the bay, a sign of a healthy ecosystem.
